line_text: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?
speaker: Michael

line_text: Oh, I told you. I couldn't close it. So...
speaker: Jim

line_text: So you've come to the master for guidance? Is this what you're saying, grasshopper?
speaker: Michael

line_text: Actually, you called me in here, but yeah.
speaker: Jim

line_text: All right. Well, let me show you how it's done.
speaker: Michael

line_text: [on the phone] Yes, I'd like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger. [quick cut scene] All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You're a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I'm sorry. OK. I'm sorry. My mistake. [hangs up] That was a woman I was talking to, so... She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so... [Clears throat] So that's the way it's done.
speaker: Michael

line_text: I've, uh, I've been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here... See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for...  forever. Right, Pam?
speaker: Michael

line_text: Well. I don't know.
speaker: Pam

line_text: If you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]
speaker: Michael

line_text: What?
speaker: Pam

line_text: Any messages?
speaker: Michael

line_text: Uh, yeah. Just a fax.
speaker: Pam

line_text: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There's a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.
speaker: Michael

line_text: You haven't told me.
speaker: Pam

line_text: It's called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.
speaker: Michael

line_text: People say I am the best boss. They go, 'God we've never worked in a place like this before. You're hilarious.' 'And you get the best out of us.' [shows the camera his WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.
speaker: Michael

line_text: [singing] Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming] I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming]
speaker: Dwight

line_text: My job is to speak to clients on the phone about... uh, quantities and type of copier paper. You know, whether we can supply it to them. Whether they can pay for it. And... I'm boring myself just talking about this.
speaker: Jim

line_text: Whassup!
speaker: Michael

line_text: Whassup! I still love that after seven years.
speaker: Jim

line_text: Whassup!
speaker: Michael

line_text: Whassup!
speaker: Dwight

line_text: Whass...up!
speaker: Michael

line_text: Whassup.
speaker: Dwight

line_text: [Strains, grunts] What?
speaker: Michael

line_text: Nothing.
speaker: Jim

line_text: OK. All right. See you later.
speaker: Michael

line_text: All right. Take care.
speaker: Jim

line_text: Back to work.
speaker: Michael

line_text: [on her cell phone] Just before lunch. That would be great.
speaker: Jan

line_text: Corporate really doesn't really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. [walking out of his office] Jan, hello.  I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because... well, not because I'm scared of her. Because I'm not. But, um... Yeah.
speaker: Michael
